TopicTitle: Mods you simply refuse to play KSP without?

Articles.Content:
What are some mods you simply refuse to play KSP without?

Mines are:

FAR

DRE

KAS

KER

KAC

AntennaRange

Edited June 3, 2014 by Tortoise

I can't play without:

FAR

KER

Kerbal Alarm Clock

Those are the three mods I consider essential, however I have a handfull of other mods that I consider very important.

All the mods, and including the Rennisance pack

Deadly Re-entry

KSP

and always curious to try mods by myself in accordance to my interest and feelings.

Mods I can't play KSP without....

uh.....

tha-no....

I li-no.....

SCREW MODS!

Simply won't do without, no matter what? None.

Can't see ever doing without, barring some weird compatibility problem so I just go without them for a day or two?

KER

Enhanced Navball

KAC

RCS Build Aid

Part Highlighter

Precise Node

Select Root

Tweakable Everything

ModuleManager

Toolbar

Can do without but don't want to:

EVE

TextureReplacer

Ambient Light Adjustement

HyperEdit

And no, that isn't just a sorted list of all my mods. I have several I like but don't consider necessary to enjoy the game.

Novapunch and Station Science, more rocket parts, stations actually have a purpose now, and I get access to a (low tech(no fuel transfers)) docking port early into career mode (I think the station science docking port is in the tier where you get the struts and launch clamps)
LLL, Stock Rebalance and Distant Object

FAR, DRE, RealChute, KW, NovaPunch, Procedural FAirings, Procedural parts, AIES, KSP Interstellar.

Edited June 3, 2014 by Taki117

I can LIVE with no mods at all, but as far as "essential" mods go, I say KAC and then HyperEdit.

HyperEdit only for testing purposes, of course, e.g. to make sure I have enough parachutes on the ship before launching the mission for real. And for the occasional middle finger to the Kraken when it decides that my beautiful spaceship deserves to start spinning around and exploding for no reason.
Texture Replacer, Chatterer and LaunchCountDown, not too big (except Texture Replacer, wich takes quite a bit of RAM ) and don't add any parts, only make gameplay a bit of a better experience

FAR, DRE, KER, Docking alignment indicator, crew manifest

Basically the utilities and realism improvements that I believe should eventually become part of the stock game (at least as a difficulty setting option). I'm also using tons of part packs and beautification mods, but these I could do without.
